p: We conducted individual interviews between 2016 and 2017 with 32 residents, one person per family (man or woman responsible for the residence). Four families are not represented in the study, since we did not find the heads of household at home, even after successive attempts. We initially recorded the socioeconomic data of the interviewees. The free-list technique was applied to indicate the wild food plants they know. To ensure that the interviewers and interviewees were dealing with the same cultural domain, we used the following stimulus: “what plants do you know that serve as food, are not cultivated and are present in forests, roadsides, vacant lots or inside plantations?”.
